analysis.heading: Contextual front setbacks
analysis.content: Contextual setbacks apply if, and only if, the average of the existing setbacks on the same side of the block is 30' or greater. How to determine if a contextual setback applies using Fig 15 below, as an example. Note: If block is more than 600' long, consider only lots within 600' (max. 10 lots).
figures: Fig 15. Example of a block with a contextual setback of 32.7' showing lot layouts with single-family and multi-family buildings, setbacks ranging from 20' to 35', and a calculation demonstrating how the average setback is determined (98 ÷ 3 = 32.7')
